exposure_duration.description: Text term used to describe the length of time the patient was exposed to an environmental factor.
value_descriptions: The text term used to describe a time period of six calendar weeks or longer.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.

exposure_duration_hrs_per_day.description: The duration (in hours per day) that a person was exposed.

exposure_duration_years.description: The period of time from start to finish of exposure, in years.

exposure_source.description: The source or location where the patient was exposed.
value_descriptions: A person's place of residence.
The surroundings or environment in which social activities occur.
The physical location where work or employment takes place.

exposure_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of environmental exposure.
value_descriptions: A fine powdery material such as dry earth or pollen that can be blown about in the air.

Any part of, or extract from, the female hemp plant Cannabis sativa. Marijuana contains cannabinoids, substances with hallucinogenic, psychoactive, and addictive properties. This agent has potential use for treating cancer pain and cachexia.

The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff. Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties.

occupation_duration_years.description: The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.

occupation_type.description: A categorization of the principal activity that a person does to earn money, as defined by the International Classification of Occupation (ISCO).

pack_years_smoked.description: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20.

parent_with_radiation_exposure.description: Indicates whether the patient's parent(s) were exposed to radiation
value_descriptions: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not provided or available.

radon_exposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to radon.
value_descriptions: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.

respirable_crystalline_silica_exposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to respirable crystalline silica, a widespread, naturally occurring, crystalline metal oxide that consists of different forms including quartz, cristobalite, tridymite, tripoli, ganister, chert, and novaculite.
value_descriptions: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

secondhand_smoke_as_child.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was exposed to secondhand smoke as a child.
value_descriptions: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.

smoking_frequency.description: The text term used to generally describe how often the patient smokes.
value_descriptions: Occurring or done each day.
A response indicating that an individual experiences or experienced something on some days.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

time_between_waking_and_first_smoke.description: The text term used to describe the approximate amount of time elapsed between the time the patient wakes up in the morning to the time they smoke their first cigarette.
value_descriptions: An indication that less than 5 minutes passes between waking and smoking the first cigarette of the day.
An indication that between 6 and 30 minutes passes between waking and smoking the first cigarette of the day.
An indication that between 31 and 60 minutes passes between waking and smoking the first cigarette of the day.
An indication that more than 60 minutes passes between waking and smoking the first cigarette of the day.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

tobacco_smoking_onset_year.description: The year in which the participant began smoking.

tobacco_smoking_quit_year.description: The year in which the participant quit smoking.

tobacco_smoking_status.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.
value_names: Current Reformed Smoker, Duration Not Specified
Current Reformed Smoker for < or = 15 yrs
value_descriptions: A person who has never smoked at the time of the interview or has smoked less than 100 cigarettes in their life.
An adult who has smoked 100 cigarettes in his or her lifetime and who currently smokes cigarettes. Includes daily smokers and non-daily smokers (also known as occasional smokers).
An individual who stopped smoking more than 15 years prior.
An individual who stopped smoking within the past 15 years.
An individual who stopped smoking an unknown number of years prior.
An indication that a person was a smoker at the time they received a pathologic diagnosis.
An indication that the smoking history of an individual is unavailable.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.
An indicator that specifies that a collection event was not permitted.

type_of_smoke_exposure.description: The text term used to describe the patient's specific type of smoke exposure.
value_names: Indoor stove or fireplace smoke, coal burning
Indoor stove or fireplace smoke, NOS
Indoor stove or fireplace smoke, wood burning
value_descriptions: Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a building fire that was not caused by deliberate human actions.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a grass fire that was not caused by deliberate human actions.
Environmental exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a fire that was not caused by deliberate human actions.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a forest fire that was not caused by deliberate human actions.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a vehicle fire that was not caused by deliberate human actions.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when an aircraft is in operation.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when trees are undergoing combustion.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when coal is rapidly oxidized via combustion.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to vaporized materials produced when food products are being cooked.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during an electrical fire.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of an electronic cigarette.
Exposure to tobacco smoke products among individuals who do not smoke. This can result from sharing space with a smoker or from placental transfer from mother to fetus.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates emitted by a factory smokestack.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when trees, brush and grass in a field are burning.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when materials are rapidly oxidized via combustion.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates emitted by a boiler or furnace.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when propane is rapidly oxidized via combustion.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during a grease fire.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates emitted by an indoor or outdoor grill used for cooking.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of a vaporized or combusted product made from cannabis plant resin.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when coal is subjected to combustion in an indoor stove or fireplace.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when materials are subjected to combustion in an indoor stove or fireplace.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when wood is subjected to combustion in an indoor stove or fireplace.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates through the direct or nearby use of a machine.

Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of a vaporized or combusted product made from the leaves and flowers of the cannabis plant.
An indication that a subject has no history of smoke exposure from any source.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when kerosene is rapidly oxidized via combustion.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when oils are rapidly oxidized via combustion.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when materials (usually wood) are burned for recreational purposes.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when materials undergo combustion or thermal decomposition.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced during indoor smoke curing of food products.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of a cigar.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of a cigarette.
Environmental, occupational or consumer-based exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by direct or nearby use of a tobacco pipe.
Environmental exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced by a volcanic event.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when trash or waste is burned.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when wood is burned in a factory setting.
Environmental or occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when wood is subjected to combustion.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the operation of a machine that produces artificial smoke.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates while preventing, controlling or extinguishing fires.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the operation of a foundry.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the operation of a power generator.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during a military posting or deployment.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates produced when materials undergo combustion or thermal decomposition.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the operation of a paint oven.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the manufacturing of plastics.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the installation of plumbing pipes and fixtures.
Occupational exposure to airborne gases and particulates during the operation of a soldering iron or welding machine.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

type_of_tobacco_used.description: The text term used to describe the specific type of tobacco used by the patient.
value_descriptions: A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking.
Finely cut tobacco encased in a wrapper of thin paper and rolled for smoking.
A battery-powered electronic device designed to atomize a nicotine-containing liquid solution for inhalation in a manner that simulates smoking a tobacco cigarette.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A tube with a small bowl at one end, especially one used for smoking tobacco.
Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.

use_per_day.description: The average number of times the patient used per day.

years_smoked.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking.

age_at_index.description: The patient's age (in years) on the reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation.

age_is_obfuscated.description: The age or other properties related to the patient's age have been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age may differ from what was reported in order to comply with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

cause_of_death.description: Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.
value_descriptions: An indication or description that a relationship to cancer exists.

A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.
Long-standing and persistent renal disease with glomerular filtration rate (GFR) less than 15 ml/min.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.
A death attributed to any cause other than the progression of a cancer-related pathologic condition.

A neoplastic or non-neoplastic condition affecting the kidney. Representative examples of non-neoplastic conditions include glomerulonephritis and nephrotic syndrome. Representative examples of neoplastic conditions include benign processes (e.g., renal lipoma and renal fibroma) and malignant processes (e.g., renal cell carcinoma and renal lymphoma).

An inherited disorder characterized by degeneration of the spinal cord and the cerebellum. Symptoms may appear at any age and include progressive loss of coordination of gait, hands, speech, and eye movements.
A disease or disorder that occurs during, soon after or as a result of a surgical procedure.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.

cause_of_death_source.description: The text term used to describe the source used to determine the patient's cause of death.
value_descriptions: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.
A certified document issued by either a medical practitioner or a governmental agency that details the date, location and cause of a death of an individual.

A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.

A publically-accessible database derived from the Social Security Administration's (SSA) Death Master File Extract. It includes a listing of the vital statistics of a majority of decedents reported to the SSA since 1962.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
Not provided or available.

days_to_birth.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.

education_level.description: The years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.
value_descriptions: Completion of education at an institution of higher education created to educate and grant degrees; often a part of a university.
Indicates a person has attended high school but did not complete high school and did not receive a high school diploma.
Indicates that a person has attended college but that they did not receive any degree.
Not provided or available.

marital_status.description: A demographic parameter indicating a person's current conjugal status.
value_descriptions: Indicates a person whose marriage has been legally dissolved and has not remarried.
Indicates a person who is a member of an unmarried couple, including same sex couples, living together in longstanding relationships, that are registered or unregistered.
Indicates a person currently joined in a legally binding matrimonial union. Classify common law marriage as married. Includes married couples living together and not living together.
Indicates a person who has never been married or whose marriages have been annulled.
A person who is separated from their spouse, whether or not there is a legal arrangement.
Indicates a person who is no longer married because of the death of his/her spouse and has not remarried.

year_of_birth.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

year_of_death.description: Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.
